00040 // create kernel call bindings
00041 template <typename T>
00042 class kernel_host_type<cupp::deviceT::vector<T> > {
00043         public:
00044                 typedef cupp::vector<T> type;
00045 };
00046 
00047 template <typename T>
00048 class kernel_device_type < cupp::vector<T> > {
00049         public:
00050                 typedef cupp::deviceT::vector<T> type;
00051 };

00063 template< typename T >
00064 class vector {
00065         public: /*** TYPEDEFS  ***/
00066                 typedef typename std::vector<T>::size_type               size_type;
00067                 typedef typename std::vector<T>::value_type              value_type;
00068                 typedef typename std::vector<T>::const_iterator          const_iterator;
00069                 typedef typename std::vector<T>::const_reverse_iterator  const_reverse_iterator;
00070 
00071                 typedef typename kernel_device_type < vector<T> >::type  device_type;
00072 
00073         public: /***  The proxy class  ***/
00074 
00083                 class element_proxy {
00084                         private: /***  Data elements  ***/
00085                                 const size_type at_;
00086                                 vector<T>& vector_;
00087                                 
00088                         public: /***  Constructors & Destructors  ***/
00089                                 element_proxy(const size_type at, vector<T>& vector) :
00090                                         at_(at), vector_(vector) {}
00091 
00092                         public: /***  Operators  ***/
00093                                 operator T() const {
00094                                         vector_.update_host();
00095                                         return vector_.data_[at_];
00096                                 }
00097                                 
00098                                 element_proxy& operator=(const element_proxy &rhs) {
00099                                         rhs.vector_.update_host();
00100                                         vector_.update_host();
00101                                         vector_.host_changes_ = true;
00102                                         vector_.data_[at_]=rhs.vector_.data_[ rhs.at_];
00103                                         return *this;
00104                                 }
00105                                 
00106                                 
00107                                 element_proxy& operator=(const T& rhs) {
00108                                         vector_.update_host();
00109                                         vector_.host_changes_ = true;
00110                                         vector_.data_[at_] = rhs;
00111                                         return *this;
00112                                 }
00113                 };
00114         
00123                 class iterator {
00124                         private: /***  Data elements  ***/
00125                                 typename std::vector<T>::iterator i_;
00126                                 vector<T>& vector_;
00127                                 
00128                         public: /***  Constructors & Destructors  ***/
00129                                 iterator(const typename std::vector<T>::iterator i, vector<T>& vector) :
00130                                         i_(i), vector_(vector) {}
00131 
00132                         public: /***  Operators  ***/
00133                                 operator typename std::vector<T>::iterator() const {
00134                                         vector_.update_host();
00135                                         return i_;
00136                                 }
00137 
00138                                 const T& operator* () const {
00139                                         vector_.update_host();
00140                                         return *i_;
00141                                 }
00142                                 
00143                                 T& operator* () {
00144                                         vector_.update_host();
00145                                         vector_.host_changes_ = true;
00146                                         return *i_;
00147                                 }
00148                                 
00149                                 const T& operator-> () const {
00150                                         vector_.update_host();
00151                                         return *i_;
00152                                 }
00153                                 
00154                                 T& operator-> () {
00155                                         vector_.update_host();
00156                                         vector_.host_changes_ = true;
00157                                         return *i_;
00158                                 }
00159 
00160                                 // prefix
00161                                 void operator++ () {
00162                                         ++i_;
00163                                 }
00164 
00165                                 // postfix
00166                                 iterator operator++ (int) {
00167                                         iterator returnee = *this;
00168                                         ++(*this);
00169                                         return returnee;
00170                                 }
00171 
00172                                 // prefix
00173                                 void operator-- () {
00174                                         --i_;
00175                                 }
00176 
00177                                 // postfix
00178                                 iterator operator-- (int) {
00179                                         iterator returnee = *this;
00180                                         --(*this);
00181                                         return returnee;
00182                                 }
00183                                 
00184                                 bool operator!= (const iterator &other) {
00185                                         return i_ != other.i_;
00186                                 }
00187 
00188                                 bool operator== (const iterator &other) {
00189                                         return i_ == other.i_;
00190                                 }
00191                 };
00192                 
00193                 typedef          std::reverse_iterator<iterator>         reverse_iterator;

00195         public: /***  CONSTRUCTORS AND DESTRUCTORS  ***/
00196         
00200                 vector() : data_(), host_changes_(true), device_changes_(false), proxy_invalid_(false), memory_(0), device_proxy_(0) {}
00201 
00205                 vector( const vector& c ) : host_changes_(true), device_changes_(false), proxy_invalid_(false), memory_(0), device_proxy_(0) {
00206                         c.update_host();
00207                         data_(c);
00208                 }

00213                 vector( size_type num, const T& val = T() ) : data_(num, val), host_changes_(true), device_changes_(false), proxy_invalid_(false), memory_(0), device_proxy_(0) {}

00224                 ~vector() {
00225                         delete memory_;
00226                         delete device_proxy_;
00227                 }

00234                 element_proxy operator[]( size_type index ) {
00235                         return element_proxy (index, *this);
00236                 }

00241                 const T& operator[]( size_type index ) const {
00242                         update_host();
00243                         return data_[index];

00249                 vector& operator=(const vector& c2) {
00250                         c2.update_host();
00251                         data_ = c2.data_;
00252                         host_changes_ = true;
00253 
00254                         // our data have been overwritten ... ignore all old data on the device
00255                         device_changes_ = false;
00256 
00257                         return *this;
00258                 }

00269                         device_changes_ = false;
00270                 }

00517                 void swap( vector<T>& from ) {
00518                         update_host();
00519                         
00520                         from.update_host();
00521                         data_.swap(from.data);
00522                         
00523                         host_changes_ = true;
00524                         from.host_changes_ = true;
00525                 }

00527         public: /*** CUPP FUNCTIONALITY  ***/
00528 
00533                 device_type get_host_based_device_copy(const device &d) const {
00534                         update_device(d);
00535 
00536                         return device_type(size(), memory_->cuda_pointer().get());
00537                 }
00538 
00543                 shared_device_pointer< device_type > get_device_based_device_copy(const device &d) const {
00544 
00545                         device_type returnee = get_host_based_device_copy(d);
00546                         
00547                         if (proxy_invalid_) {
00548                                 delete device_proxy_;
00549                                 device_proxy_ = new memory1d<device_type> (d, &returnee, 1);
00550                                 proxy_invalid_ = false;
00551                         }
00552 
00553                         return device_proxy_->cuda_pointer();
00554                 }
00555 
00559                 void dirty (const device &d, shared_device_pointer< device_type > device_copy) const {
00560                         device_changes_ = true;
00561                 }
00562 
00566                 void update_host() const {
00567                         if (device_changes_) {
00568                                 assert(!host_changes_);
00569                                 
00570                                 memory_ -> copy_to_host (&data_[0]);
00571                                 
00572                                 device_changes_ = false;
00573                         }
00574                 }
00575 
00579                 void update_device(const device &d) const {
00580                 
00581                         // changes on the host side or we are executed on a new device
00582                         if (host_changes_ || &d != device_ptr_) {
00583                                 assert (!device_changes_);
00584                                 // we don't have any space on the device, or the we have more/less space on the device than we neeed
00585                                 // or we are executed on a new device
00586                                 if (memory_ == 0 || memory_ -> size()!=data_.size() || &d != device_ptr_) {
00587                                         // free the memory
00588                                         delete memory_;
00589                                         
00590                                         // get new memory and copy the data
00591                                         memory_ = new memory1d<T>(d, &data_[0], data_.size() );
00592 
00593                                         // we need to create a new proxy because our memory has a new address
00594                                         proxy_invalid_ = true;
00595                                 } else {
00596                                         // copy the data to the device
00597                                         memory_ -> copy_to_device (&data_[0]);
00598                                 }
00599 
00600                                 device_ptr_ = const_cast<device*> (&d);
00601                                 host_changes_ = false;
00602                         }
00603                 }
00604

00615                 mutable bool host_changes_;
00616

00621

00626

00635                 mutable memory1d<device_type> *device_proxy_;
00636 
00640                 mutable device *device_ptr_;

00643 template <typename T1, typename T2>
00644 bool operator==(const vector<T1>& c1, const vector<T2>& c2) {
00645         c1.update_host();
00646         c2.update_host();
00647         return c1.data_ == c2.data_;
00648 }
00649 
00650 template <typename T1, typename T2>
00651 bool operator!=(const vector<T1>& c1, const vector<T2>& c2) {
00652         return !(c1 == c2);
00653 }
00654 
00655 template <typename T1, typename T2>
00656 bool operator<(const vector<T1>& c1, const vector<T2>& c2) {
00657         c1.update_host();
00658         c2.update_host();
00659         return c1.data_ < c2.data_; 
00660 }
00661 
00662 template <typename T1, typename T2>
00663 bool operator>(const vector<T1>& c1, const vector<T2>& c2) {
00664         c1.update_host();
00665         c2.update_host();
00666         return c1.data_ > c2.data_;
00667 }
00668 
00669 template <typename T1, typename T2>
00670 bool operator<=(const vector<T1>& c1, const vector<T2>& c2) {
00671         return !(c1 > c2);
00672 }
00673 
00674 template <typename T1, typename T2>
00675 bool operator>=(const vector<T1>& c1, const vector<T2>& c2) {
00676         return !(c1 < c2);
00677 }
